message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.SI

The paper deals with information theory and its application in big data scenarios such as anomaly detection and security systems. It proposes a new measure called message importance measure (MIM) and compares it with Shannon entropy, which is a fundamental concept in information theory. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Information Theory (cs.IT). Additionally, the paper proposes new strategies for information processing, transmission, and compression, which involve machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques. Hence, it could also be classified under Machine Learning (cs.LG) and Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-categories. Furthermore, the paper discusses security systems, which could fall under the sub-category of Cryptography and Security (cs.CR). Finally, the paper deals with big data scenarios, which could be classified under the sub-category of Social and Information Networks (cs.SI).
